text: Simon Wilson is a British actor. He was born on 3 February 1981 in Swindon. He had a brief run on the television show Eastenders in 2010, playing the role of Mr. Steele. He also played the role of Andrew Parker Bowles in the 2005 made- for-television movie Charles & Camilla: Whatever Love Means. ==Career== ===Film=== {| class = "wikitable sortable" |- !style="background:#B0C4DE;" | Year !style="background:#B0C4DE;" | Title !style="background:#B0C4DE;" | Role !style="background:#B0C4DE;" | Notes |- | 2012 | Now Is Good | Suit |- | 2011 | The Best Exotic Marigold Hotel | Madge's Son-in-Law |- |} ===Television=== {| class = "wikitable sortable" |- !style="background:#B0C4DE;" | Year !style="background:#B0C4DE;" | Title !style="background:#B0C4DE;" | Role !style="background:#B0C4DE;" | Notes |- | 2010 | EastEnders | Mr. Steele | TV Series |- | 2005 | Charles & Camilla: Whatever Love Means | Andrew Parker Bowles | Made for ITV1 and premiered in the USA on the Lifetime (TV network) |- |} ===Theatre=== {| class = "wikitable sortable" |- !style="background:#B0C4DE;" | Year !style="background:#B0C4DE;" | Title !style="background:#B0C4DE;" | Role !style="background:#B0C4DE;" | Notes |- | 2006 | The Comedy of Errors | Antipholus of Ephesus | Directed by Christopher Luscombe at The Globe Theatre (London) |- |} ==External links== * ==References== Category:1981 births Category:Living people Category:Actors from Swindon Category:21st-century English male actors
